title: Acts Chapter 20 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 20 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 20 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 20.

questions.question: After the uproar ceased, where did Paul decide to go?
questions.correctAnswer: Macedonia
questions.explanation: Acts 20:1 states that after the uproar was ceased, Paul departed to go into Macedonia.

questions.question: How long did Paul stay in Greece according to Acts 20?
questions.correctAnswer: Three months
questions.explanation: Acts 20:3 notes that Paul abode in Greece for three months.

questions.question: Who accompanied Paul into Asia from Berea?
questions.correctAnswer: Sopater
questions.explanation: Acts 20:4 states Sopater of Berea accompanied Paul into Asia.

questions.question: Where did Paul and the others stay for seven days?
questions.correctAnswer: Troas
questions.explanation: Acts 20:6 says they came to Troas and abode there for seven days.

questions.question: On which day of the week did the disciples come together to break bread?
questions.correctAnswer: First day
questions.explanation: Acts 20:7 states that on the first day of the week the disciples came together to break bread.

questions.question: What happened to the young man named Eutychus during Paul's long preaching?
options: He fell asleep and fell from the third loft
questions.correctAnswer: He fell asleep and fell from the third loft
questions.explanation: Acts 20:9 describes Eutychus falling into a deep sleep and falling from the third loft.

questions.question: What did Paul say when he embraced Eutychus after he fell?
options: Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him
He is dead; we must grieve
questions.correctAnswer: Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him
questions.explanation: Acts 20:10 records Paul saying not to be troubled because Eutychus's life was in him.

questions.question: Where did Paul intend to sail by, but chose not to spend time there?
questions.correctAnswer: Ephesus
questions.explanation: Acts 20:16 states Paul determined to sail by Ephesus but would not spend time there.

questions.question: Who did Paul call from Ephesus to meet him at Miletus?
questions.correctAnswer: The elders of the church
questions.explanation: Acts 20:17 states Paul sent for the elders of the church in Ephesus to come to him.

questions.question: According to Paul, how did he serve the Lord among the Ephesians?
questions.correctAnswer: With humility, tears, and temptations
questions.explanation: Acts 20:19 describes Paul serving the Lord with all humility of mind, many tears, and temptations.

questions.question: True or False: Paul said he was bound in the spirit to go to Jerusalem, not knowing what would happen to him there.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 20:22 confirms Paul was bound in the spirit to Jerusalem, uncertain of what would happen.

questions.question: True or False: Paul considered his life dear to himself and was afraid to finish his ministry.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 20:24 shows Paul did not count his life dear and wanted to finish his course with joy.

questions.question: True or False: Paul warned the elders that after his departure, grievous wolves would enter the church.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 20:29 states Paul warned that grievous wolves would enter among them after he left.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'It is more blessed to ______ than to receive.'
questions.correctAnswer: give
questions.explanation: Acts 20:35 quotes Jesus saying it is more blessed to give than to receive.

questions.question: What did Paul do after speaking with the elders at Miletus?
options: He kneeled down and prayed with them
questions.correctAnswer: He kneeled down and prayed with them
questions.explanation: Acts 20:36 records Paul kneeling down and praying with the elders after speaking to them.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 20 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 20 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Acts 20:24 teach us about perseverance through trials in ministry?
options: Paul counts his life as dear and avoids hardship
Paul is not moved by trials but aims to finish his course with joy
Paul seeks comfort and rest to avoid difficulties
Paul focuses only on his own well-being
questions.correctAnswer: Paul is not moved by trials but aims to finish his course with joy
questions.explanation: Acts 20:24 shows Paul's determination to persevere despite bonds and afflictions, emphasizing finishing his ministry joyfully. This teaches believers to endure trials faithfully (Acts 20:22-24, 31).

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with discouragement in serving others. Based on Acts 20:35, what biblical truth would you share?
options: It is more blessed to receive than to give
Serving others is optional in Christian life
It is more blessed to give than to receive
questions.correctAnswer: It is more blessed to give than to receive
questions.explanation: Acts 20:35 reminds believers of Jesus' teaching that giving brings greater blessing than receiving, encouraging generous service and support for the weak (Acts 20:34-35).

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize about honesty and integrity in Acts 20:33-34?
options: Paul covets silver and gold from the believers
Paul worked with his own hands to meet his needs
Paul relied solely on the church for support
questions.correctAnswer: Paul worked with his own hands to meet his needs
questions.explanation: Acts 20:33-34 highlights Paul's refusal to covet others' possessions and his hard work to provide for himself and companions, modeling integrity and work ethic.

questions.question: According to Acts 20:28, what responsibility do church leaders have toward their congregation?
options: To seek personal gain from the church
To feed the church of God, which He purchased with His blood
To ignore the flock and focus on doctrine only
To serve only those in positions of power
questions.correctAnswer: To feed the church of God, which He purchased with His blood
questions.explanation: Acts 20:28 teaches that church leaders are overseers appointed by the Holy Spirit to care for and nourish the church, recognizing its great value as bought by Christ's blood.

questions.question: How does Acts 20:21 guide us in evangelism and sharing the Gospel?
options: Testify only to the Jews about the law
Preach repentance toward God and faith in Jesus Christ to all people
questions.correctAnswer: Preach repentance toward God and faith in Jesus Christ to all people
questions.explanation: Acts 20:21 shows Paul's inclusive approach in testifying both to Jews and Greeks about repentance and faith, encouraging believers to share the Gospel widely.

questions.question: What can we learn about prayer and personal devotion from Paul’s actions in Acts 20:36?
options: Paul refused to pray with others
Paul kneeled down and prayed with all present
questions.correctAnswer: Paul kneeled down and prayed with all present
questions.explanation: Acts 20:36 demonstrates Paul's humility and devotion in prayer with the church elders, modeling the importance of communal prayer and dependence on God.

questions.question: Based on Acts 20:18-19, how does Paul exemplify humility in ministry?
options: By serving the Lord with humility, tears, and enduring temptations
By demanding honor and respect from believers
questions.correctAnswer: By serving the Lord with humility, tears, and enduring temptations
questions.explanation: Acts 20:18-19 highlights Paul's humble service despite hardships, teaching believers to serve God with a humble heart in trials.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 20:22-23, Paul was unaware of the suffering awaiting him in Jerusalem.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 20:22-23 states Paul was bound in the spirit to Jerusalem but did not know the exact things that would happen, though the Holy Spirit warned him of bonds and afflictions.

questions.question: True or False: Acts 20 warns that after Paul’s departure, false teachers will arise within the church.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 20:29-30 warns elders that grievous wolves and men speaking perverse things will arise to draw disciples away, emphasizing vigilance in church leadership.

questions.question: How does Acts 20:31 teach us about spiritual discipline in ministry?
options: Paul ceased warning the church after a short time
Paul warned the church night and day with tears for three years
Paul only taught publicly and avoided personal warnings
Paul focused on financial matters over spiritual warnings
questions.correctAnswer: Paul warned the church night and day with tears for three years
questions.explanation: Acts 20:31 shows Paul's persistent and heartfelt commitment to spiritual discipline and care, encouraging believers to diligently warn and teach one another.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to prioritize personal gain over serving others. Based on Acts 20:33, what counsel would help them?
options: It is acceptable to covet others' possessions
Paul coveted silver and gold for his ministry
Paul did not covet anyone’s silver, gold, or apparel
Serving others is less important than personal wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Paul did not covet anyone’s silver, gold, or apparel
questions.explanation: Acts 20:33 teaches contentment and integrity by Paul’s example of not coveting others’ possessions, prioritizing faithful service over gain.

questions.question: What encouragement does Paul give to the Ephesian elders in Acts 20:32 regarding spiritual growth?
options: He commends them to wealth and fame
He commends them to God and the word of His grace to build them up
He tells them to rely on human wisdom
He instructs them to seek power in the church
questions.correctAnswer: He commends them to God and the word of His grace to build them up
questions.explanation: Acts 20:32 encourages reliance on God's grace and word as the foundation for spiritual growth and inheritance among the sanctified.

questions.question: What does Acts 20:27 reveal about Paul's approach to sharing God's counsel?
options: He shunned to declare the counsel of God
He declared all the counsel of God without shunning anything
questions.correctAnswer: He declared all the counsel of God without shunning anything
questions.explanation: Acts 20:27 shows Paul's boldness and completeness in teaching the full counsel of God, encouraging believers to be faithful and thorough in sharing truth.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Acts 20:38, the believers were sorrowing because Paul said they would see his face _____ more.
questions.correctAnswer: no
questions.explanation: Acts 20:38 records the sorrow of believers because Paul said they would not see his face again, highlighting the emotional cost of ministry and separation.

questions.question: How does Acts 20:21 encourage believers in their witness to others?
options: By testifying only to those like themselves
By testifying both to Jews and Greeks about repentance and faith
By avoiding sharing the Gospel publicly
By focusing solely on religious rituals
questions.correctAnswer: By testifying both to Jews and Greeks about repentance and faith
questions.explanation: Acts 20:21 shows Paul's inclusive witness to all people, encouraging believers to share the Gospel broadly across cultural boundaries.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 20 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 20.

questions.question: Which group did Paul call and embrace before departing for Macedonia after the uproar ceased?
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples
questions.explanation: Acts 20:1 states that after the uproar ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, embraced them, and departed for Macedonia.

questions.question: In Acts 20, Paul stayed three months in which location before deciding to return through Macedonia?
questions.correctAnswer: Greece
questions.explanation: Acts 20:3 explains that Paul abode three months in Greece before changing his travel plans due to a plot against him.

questions.question: Who accompanied Paul into Asia, as mentioned in Acts 20?
options: Sopater of Berea, Aristarchus, Secundus, Gaius, Timotheus, Tychicus, and Trophimus
questions.correctAnswer: Sopater of Berea, Aristarchus, Secundus, Gaius, Timotheus, Tychicus, and Trophimus
questions.explanation: Acts 20:4 lists the companions who accompanied Paul into Asia by name, highlighting the diversity of his missionary team.

questions.question: What event took place on the first day of the week when disciples came together in Troas?
options: Paul preached until midnight and they broke bread
questions.correctAnswer: Paul preached until midnight and they broke bread
questions.explanation: Acts 20:7 describes the disciples gathering on the first day of the week to break bread while Paul preached until midnight.

questions.question: What happened to Eutychus while Paul was preaching in Troas?
options: He fell asleep and fell from the third loft, taken up dead
He was healed of an illness
He was sent to deliver a message to the elders
questions.correctAnswer: He fell asleep and fell from the third loft, taken up dead
questions.explanation: Acts 20:9 recounts that Eutychus, sitting in a window, fell into a deep sleep and fell from the third loft, being taken up dead.

questions.question: How did Paul respond to Eutychus's fall and apparent death?
options: Paul embraced him and said his life was in him
Paul left him for the elders to tend
Paul immediately called for a doctor
questions.correctAnswer: Paul embraced him and said his life was in him
questions.explanation: Acts 20:10 shows Paul's immediate action to embrace Eutychus and assure those present that his life was still in him.

questions.question: Why did Paul choose to sail by Ephesus but not spend time there?
options: He was hastening to be at Jerusalem by Pentecost
He was afraid of persecution in Ephesus
He had completed his mission in Ephesus
He wanted to avoid the Jewish leaders in Ephesus
questions.correctAnswer: He was hastening to be at Jerusalem by Pentecost
questions.explanation: Acts 20:16 explains Paul's determination to sail by Ephesus without spending time there because he was hasting to reach Jerusalem for Pentecost.

questions.question: What did Paul emphasize to the elders of the church from Ephesus regarding his ministry?
options: He served the Lord with humility, many tears, and did not shrink from declaring God's counsel
He sought wealth and honor among the people
He avoided teaching in private homes
He only preached to the Jews, not the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: He served the Lord with humility, many tears, and did not shrink from declaring God's counsel
questions.explanation: Acts 20:19-27 highlights Paul's humble service, perseverance through trials, and his boldness in declaring God's full counsel to the Ephesian elders.

questions.question: What warning did Paul give about future challenges to the Ephesian church?
options: Grievous wolves and perverse men would arise to draw away disciples
Roman authorities would imprison them all
False teachers would be easily recognized and defeated
The church would face no further opposition
questions.correctAnswer: Grievous wolves and perverse men would arise to draw away disciples
questions.explanation: Acts 20:29-30 records Paul's warning of grievous wolves and men speaking perverse things who would come to lead disciples astray after his departure.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul said, 'It is more blessed to _____ than to receive.'
questions.correctAnswer: give
questions.explanation: Acts 20:35 quotes Paul reminding that the Lord Jesus said, 'It is more blessed to give than to receive,' emphasizing generosity.

questions.question: True or False: Paul claimed he coveted silver, gold, and apparel from the believers.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 20:33 explicitly states Paul did not covet anyone's silver, gold, or apparel, demonstrating his integrity and self-support.

questions.question: What did Paul do after speaking to the Ephesian elders, causing them to weep and embrace him?
options: He kneeled down and prayed with them
He left immediately without further words
questions.correctAnswer: He kneeled down and prayed with them
questions.explanation: Acts 20:36-37 describes Paul kneeling and praying with the elders, which led to their sorrowful embrace and tears.

questions.question: How does Paul's farewell speech in Acts 20 relate to Old Testament prophetic farewell speeches?
options: Like Moses in Deuteronomy, Paul solemnly warns and charges the leaders before his departure
It is unrelated and purely personal
It mimics Elijah's confrontation with Ahab
It follows David's psalm of lament
questions.correctAnswer: Like Moses in Deuteronomy, Paul solemnly warns and charges the leaders before his departure
questions.explanation: Paul's charge to the Ephesian elders in Acts 20:18-38 parallels Moses' farewell in Deuteronomy, emphasizing leadership responsibility and warning of future danger.

questions.question: Which theme in Acts 20 is foreshadowed by Paul’s statement about going to Jerusalem bound in the spirit, not knowing what will happen?
questions.correctAnswer: His impending arrest and suffering
questions.explanation: Acts 20:22-23 foreshadows Paul's upcoming trials in Jerusalem, including bonds and afflictions, which are later fully realized in Acts 21-28.

questions.question: What cultural significance does the gathering on the first day of the week have in Acts 20:7?
options: It marks the early Christian observance of the Lord's Day, distinct from the Jewish Sabbath
It was a traditional Jewish feast day
It was an informal meeting with no particular significance
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the early Christian observance of the Lord's Day, distinct from the Jewish Sabbath
questions.explanation: Acts 20:7 indicates early Christians gathered on the first day of the week, which later became known as the Lord's Day, symbolizing Jesus' resurrection and new covenant worship.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 20 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 20 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was Paul's primary purpose in calling the elders of the church at Ephesus to meet him in Miletus?
options: To warn them about coming grievous wolves
To receive financial support for his journey
To appoint new leaders for the church
questions.correctAnswer: To warn them about coming grievous wolves
questions.explanation: Acts 20:28-30 shows Paul warning the Ephesian elders about 'grievous wolves' entering among them after his departure; this reflects Jesus' teaching about false teachers (Matthew 7:15), and the apostolic concern for church purity (2 Timothy 3:13; Jude 1:12-13).

questions.question: According to Acts 20, how did Paul describe his ministry among the Ephesians?
options: With all humility, many tears, and temptations
questions.correctAnswer: With all humility, many tears, and temptations
questions.explanation: Acts 20:19 states Paul served 'with all humility of mind, and with many tears, and temptations,' reflecting the apostolic pattern of suffering and humility (2 Corinthians 11:23-28; Philippians 2:3; 1 Peter 4:12-13).

questions.question: What spiritual charge did Paul give to the Ephesian elders regarding the church?
options: To feed the church of God, which He purchased with His own blood
To avoid persecution at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: To feed the church of God, which He purchased with His own blood
questions.explanation: Acts 20:28 commands elders to 'feed the church of God, which He hath purchased with his own blood,' highlighting Christ’s sacrificial atonement (1 Peter 1:18-19; Ephesians 5:25; Hebrews 9:12-14).

questions.question: How did Paul express his attitude toward his own life in light of his ministry?
options: He did not count his life dear unto himself
He sought to protect his life at all costs
He was indifferent about his life
questions.correctAnswer: He did not count his life dear unto himself
questions.explanation: Acts 20:24 shows Paul’s self-sacrificial mindset: 'neither count I my life dear unto myself,' consistent with Jesus’ teaching on self-denial (Luke 9:23), and the apostolic call to endure suffering (2 Timothy 4:7).

questions.question: What did Paul say was able to build up the believers and give them an inheritance among the sanctified?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God's grace
questions.explanation: Acts 20:32 emphasizes the power of 'the word of his grace' to edify and grant inheritance, paralleling similar teachings in Hebrews 4:12, 1 Peter 1:23, and John 1:14 about the living, active word of God.

questions.question: Who was the young man that fell asleep during Paul's long preaching and fell from the third loft?
questions.correctAnswer: Eutychus
questions.explanation: Acts 20:9 identifies the young man as Eutychus who fell asleep and fell from the third story, illustrating human frailty and God's power to restore life (John 11:25-26; 2 Kings 4:32-37).

questions.question: What did Paul do after Eutychus fell and was taken up dead?
options: Embraced him and said his life was in him
Stopped preaching and left the room
questions.correctAnswer: Embraced him and said his life was in him
questions.explanation: Acts 20:10 records Paul embracing Eutychus and assuring the people not to be troubled, showing apostolic authority and Christ’s power over death (Romans 8:11; Mark 5:41-42).

questions.question: What did Paul emphasize about his teaching among the Ephesians?
options: He kept back nothing profitable, teaching publicly and from house to house
He taught only in the temple courts
He shared only with the Jewish leaders
questions.correctAnswer: He kept back nothing profitable, teaching publicly and from house to house
questions.explanation: Acts 20:20 states Paul taught openly and from house to house without withholding profitable truths, aligning with Jesus’ model of thorough teaching (Luke 4:16-21; 2 Timothy 4:2).

questions.question: What two core elements did Paul testify to both Jews and Greeks according to Acts 20?
options: Repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Acts 20:21 summarizes Paul's gospel preaching as 'repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ,' consistent with the Great Commission (Mark 1:15; Romans 1:16).

questions.question: What did Paul say the Holy Spirit was testifying in every city concerning his future?
options: That bonds and afflictions awaited him
That he would be granted great success
That he would live a long peaceful life
That he would become a prominent leader
questions.correctAnswer: That bonds and afflictions awaited him
questions.explanation: Acts 20:23 reveals the Holy Spirit warned Paul of upcoming 'bonds and afflictions,' reflecting the Spirit’s role in guiding and preparing believers for suffering (John 16:7-8; Romans 8:17).

questions.question: How long did Paul say he warned the Ephesian church night and day with tears?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: Acts 20:31 notes Paul’s continuous warning over three years, demonstrating faithful pastoral care and perseverance in ministry (Galatians 4:13; 2 Corinthians 11:28).

questions.question: What labor principle did Paul teach the Ephesian believers to follow?
options: To support the weak and remember Jesus' words that it is more blessed to give than to receive
To work only for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: To support the weak and remember Jesus' words that it is more blessed to give than to receive
questions.explanation: Acts 20:35 instructs believers to labor in supporting the weak, echoing Jesus’ teaching about blessing in generosity (Luke 6:38; 2 Corinthians 9:7).

questions.question: In Acts 20, how did Paul describe his attitude toward material wealth during his ministry?
options: He coveted no man's silver, gold, or apparel
He sought to gain wealth for himself
He depended on wealthy patrons exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: He coveted no man's silver, gold, or apparel
questions.explanation: Acts 20:33 shows Paul’s integrity and refusal to covet material possessions, consistent with his teaching on contentment and labor (1 Timothy 6:6-10; Philippians 4:11-13).

questions.question: What did Paul do after he finished speaking with the Ephesian elders in Miletus?
options: He kneeled down and prayed with them all
questions.correctAnswer: He kneeled down and prayed with them all
questions.explanation: Acts 20:36 records Paul kneeling and praying with the elders, demonstrating apostolic devotion and pastoral care (Luke 22:41; Ephesians 6:18).

questions.question: What emotional response did the Ephesian elders have upon Paul's farewell?
options: They wept sore, fell on his neck, and kissed him
questions.correctAnswer: They wept sore, fell on his neck, and kissed him
questions.explanation: Acts 20:37 describes the elders' deep sorrow at Paul's departure, reflecting the strong bonds within early Christian communities (John 13:36-38; Romans 12:15).
